senses.synonym: relax: become less tense, rest, or take one's ease; 'He relaxed in the hot tub'; 'Let's all relax after a hard day's work' <i21894>

relations.target: chill: loose heat; 'The air cooled considerably after the thunderstorm' <i23583>
relax: become less tense, less formal, or less restrained, and assume a friendlier manner; 'our new colleague relaxed when he saw that we were a friendly group' <i34700>
